greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n if n <= 3, otherwise the smallest number not occurring earlier having at least one common factor with a(n-2)*a(n-3), but none with a(n-1).
comment: The sequence differs from A098550 from a(11) onward.
The sequence is a permutation of the natural numbers. The proof is similar to that for A098550 (with minor changes). - _Vladimir Shevelev_, Jan 14 2015
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
David L. Applegate, Hans Havermann, Bob Selcoe, Vladimir Shevelev, N. J. A. Sloane, and Reinhard Zumkeller, The Yellowstone Permutation, arXiv preprint arXiv:1501.01669, 2015.
maple: if not assigned(b[k]) and igcd(k,q) > 1 and igcd(k,a[n-1]) = 1 then
mathematica: a[n_ /; n <= 3] := n; a[n_] := a[n] = For[aa = Table[a[j], {j, 1, n-1}]; k=4, True, k++, If[FreeQ[aa, k] && !CoprimeQ[k, a[n-2]*a[n-3]] && CoprimeQ[k, a[n-1]], Return[k]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 60}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 12 2015 *)
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Jan 11 2015
